body: I've just started cglicking and I can control about 12cps while PvPing. But I was wondering, will this affect my health in anyway?
body_tagged: I've just started cglicking and I can control about 12cps while PvPing. But I was wondering, will this affect my health in anyway?
title: Is jitter clicking bad?

replies.body: Some (only some ) say it can damage your vanes.
replies.body_tagged: Some (only some ) say it can damage your vanes.

replies.body: It depends on how long, if you do it for like 2 hours every day, you'll get some tendinitis or sumthing bad on your hands
replies.body_tagged: It depends on how long, if you do it for like 2 hours every day, you'll get some tendinitis or sumthing bad on your hands

replies.body: Shaking to click way faster than normal, look for it on yt
replies.body_tagged: Shaking to click way faster than normal, look for it on yt

replies.body: It is. Your arm muscles gets worn.
replies.body_tagged: It is. Your arm muscles gets worn.

reply_to.body: Some (only some ) say it can damage your vanes.
reply_to.body_tagged: Some (only some ) say it can damage your vanes.

replies.body: vibrating your arm to click really fast.
replies.body_tagged: vibrating your arm to click really fast.

replies.body: I think it increases the chance of carpol tunnel
replies.body_tagged: I think it increases the chance of carpol tunnel

replies.body: don't jitter click always, it will cauase your arm to ache for days. jitter click on too start of a battle or too defend your self
replies.body_tagged: don't jitter click always, it will cauase your arm to ache for days. jitter click on too start of a battle or too defend your self

replies.body: There's no point in jitter clicking. If you can strafe, that's all you need to PvP, it's not about hitting extremely fast.
replies.body_tagged: There's no point in jitter clicking. If you can strafe, that's all you need to PvP, it's not about hitting extremely fast.

replies.body:
Yeh, it harms your health ;C
not worth it
replies.body_tagged:
Yeh, it harms your health ;C
not worth it

replies.body: Many people think its pointless because Minecraft only register a few clicks per second. But the faster you click, the faster you will hit your opponent once he is within range and you're aim is at him. But 12 cps while pvp'ing doesn't make a big difference from 8 cps. So, click fast, but not to fast.
replies.body_tagged: Many people think its pointless because Minecraft only register a few clicks per second. But the faster you click, the faster you will hit your opponent once he is within range and you're aim is at him. But 12 cps while pvp'ing doesn't make a big difference from 8 cps. So, click fast, but not to fast.

replies.body: Jitter clicking is fine, it just all depends really on how often you do it. As said above, it can make your arm ache for long periods of time depending on how fast and how long you do it for.
replies.body_tagged: Jitter clicking is fine, it just all depends really on how often you do it. As said above, it can make your arm ache for long periods of time depending on how fast and how long you do it for.

replies.body: Well, mixed answers.. I'm not going to risk my health over a game :P Thanks for your help everyone! ^.^
replies.body_tagged: Well, mixed answers.. I'm not going to risk my health over a game :P Thanks for your help everyone! ^.^

replies.body: Aiming is harder when jitter clicking, but I reccommend you not unless you're straight-lining.
replies.body_tagged: Aiming is harder when jitter clicking, but I reccommend you not unless you're straight-lining.

replies.body: If you're straightlining, a good rule of thumb is not to straightline.
replies.body_tagged: If you're straightlining, a good rule of thumb is not to straightline.

reply_to.body: Aiming is harder when jitter clicking, but I reccommend you not unless you're straight-lining.
reply_to.body_tagged: Aiming is harder when jitter clicking, but I reccommend you not unless you're straight-lining.

replies.body: I only straight-line to get people mad though :<
replies.body_tagged: I only straight-line to get people mad though :<

reply_to.body: If you're straightlining, a good rule of thumb is not to straightline.
reply_to.body_tagged: If you're straightlining, a good rule of thumb is not to straightline.

replies.body: I watched a "jitter-clicking" tutorial and couldn't stop laughing, as I found it quite amazing and retarded at the same time. xD
